author: globo.com
title: Parintins vence por 3 a 0, garante vaga no mata-mata do returno e rebaixa o Sete FC | campeonato amazonense | ge
text:
O Parintins confirmou a sua vaga no mata-mata do segundo turno do Campeonato Amazonense. Na tarde desta quarta-feira, no estádio Ismael Benigno (Colina), venceu o Sete FC por 3 a 0. Os gols da vitória foram marcados por Inácio Neto, Digão e Dagson.
Com a vitória, o Parintins chegou aos cinco pontos e vai aguardar o resultado de Manaus e Princesa, ambos com quatro pontos, que se enfrentam ainda nesta quarta. Somente após a partida será possível definir se o Tourão irá para as semifinais de forma direta ou para os playoffs. Para subir para as semis, torcerá por um empate entre Gavião e Tubarão.
Já o Sete FC, que subiu na temporada passada, foi rebaixado matematicamente para a segunda divisão.
1 de 2 Parintins x Sete FC — Foto: Chicão Marques/Parintins FC Parintins x Sete FC — Foto: Chicão Marques/Parintins FC
O jogo
O duelo começou em meio a muita chuva no estádio da Colina. Mas, desde o início, o Parintins tomou iniciativa da partida, com os principais lances de ataque. E as principais jogadas de ataque do Tourão saíram dos pés de Rodriguinho e Inácio Neto.
Aos 22, Rodriguinho avançou pela direita e cruzou para Inácio, sozinho em cima do gol, mas o atacante mandou para fora. Mas de tanto insistir, o Parintins foi premiado aos 45 minutos. Dessa vez, Inácio aproveitou o cruzamento de Rodriguinho e abriu o placar: 1 a 0.
2 de 2 Parintins x Sete FC — Foto: Chicão Marques/Parintins FC Parintins x Sete FC — Foto: Chicão Marques/Parintins FC
Segundo tempo
Na segunda etapa, o Parintins continuou no ataque e conseguiu o gol logo aos 10 minutos. Após escanteio, Digão subiu mais alto que a zaga e marcou de cabeça: 2 a 0. O Tourão continuou melhor na partida e, aos 23 minutos, conseguiu o terceiro gol, com Dagson de cabeça, após cruzamento de Rodriguinho da direita.
Aos 27 minutos, Douglas Lopes sofreu pênalti. O Parintins teve a chance de marcar o quarto gol, em cobrança de pênalti de Rodriguinho, mas ficou na defesa do goleiro Marcos.

author: Zach Staton
title: ODU women grind out 62-56 win over South Alabama to tip off Sun Belt play
text: MOBILE, Ala. (WTKR) — Old Dominion women's basketball began Sun Belt play on the right foot with a 62-56 win over South Alabama on the road Saturday afternoon. Trailing by four at halftime, the Monarchs surged in the third quarter with a couple of threes by Brenda Fontana, tying the game up at 34-34 just 1:23 into the second half. From that point, ODU outscored South Alabama 15-8 the rest of the quarter with an Ivi Nikolova three at the 2:50 mark giving the silver a 41-39 lead. Delisha Milton-Jones' group continued to grow the lead in the final ten minutes of the game, with a Jordan McLaughlin layup extending the advantage to 53-44 with 7:24 left to play. A comeback attempt by the Jaguars was thwarted time and time again by the Monarchs, who also handed Delisha Milton-Jones her 100th career win. McLaughlin finished the game with 12 points to lead ODU, while En'Dya Buford and Kaye Clark chipped in ten a piece. ODU gets out to a 1-0 start in the Sun Belt and improves to 9-2 on the season. They'll return to Norfolk with a game against Louisiana on Thursday.

author: Amy Beth Hanson
title: Colorado Red Lobster restaurant finds rare orange lobster in shipment, takes it to Denver aquarium
text: The Downtown Aquarium in Denver has a new resident — a rare orange lobster that was rescued from a shipment of crustaceans delivered to a Red Lobster restaurant in Pueblo, Colorado. A long-term employee who is a dishwasher and head biscuit maker spotted the bright orange lobster while unpacking a shipment last Friday and alerted restaurant managers, aquarium officials said. The staff named it Crush after the Denver Broncos' legendary Orange Crush defense from 1976 to 1986. Recommended Videos “Myself and many of my team are born and raised Denver Broncos fans, so as soon as we saw that orange color, we knew that Crush would be an excellent representation,” said Kendra Kastendieck, the restaurant's general manager. “And we all want our defensive line to be that good again." When the Pueblo Zoo couldn't take Crush, Kastendieck called the Downtown Aquarium, which she said was interested right away. Kastendieck packed Crush with ice packs in a plastic foam container and delivered it to the aquarium on Wednesday. “As soon as they acclimated him to his quarantine tank at the Denver aquarium, he was very active right off the bat and was really exploring his little area,” Kastendieck said Thursday. Staff had set up a tank with a new generation Denver Broncos helmet on top and an older generation one sitting in the tank “so he can actually climb into it and play around it,” she said. Crush will be examined by a veterinarian and after 30 days in quarantine will be placed in the “Lurks” exhibit that houses other cold water North Atlantic Ocean species, aquarium staff said. “We are thrilled to be able to share this very rare and extraordinary animal with the community and visitors to Colorado,” Ryan Herman, general curator at Denver Downtown Aquarium, said in a statement. Crush was shipped to the Pueblo restaurant from a supplier in Tennessee. It was caught off a coast of Canada, said Kastendieck, but she was unable to confirm which coast. Genetic mutations can lead to lobsters that are orange, blue and yellow. Downtown Aquarium has had one orange lobster previously. The Downtown Aquarium has more than 700 species of fish along with a stingray reef and three Sumatran tigers. ___ Hanson reported from Helena, Montana.

author: 世界新聞網
title: 2中國學生在韓偷拍軍事設施被捕 輿論質疑身分
text:
2中國學生在韓偷拍軍事設施被捕 輿論質疑身分
2名中國高中生日前因在京畿道第10戰鬥飛行團附近偷拍軍機遭捕，其中一人聲稱父親為中國公安，引發輿論對其身分質疑。調查當局指出，除軍機外，他們還拍攝了多處軍事設施及機場。
這2名中國高中生3月18日從仁川國際機場入境韓國，之後便帶著裝有望遠鏡的相機及手機前往韓美軍事設施及各主要國際機場拍攝。據當局調查，他們拍攝了大量水原、烏山、平澤、清州等地的空軍基地，以及仁川、金浦、濟州機場的照片。
2人之後在同月21日下午於水原的戰鬥飛行團基地附近以相機及手機拍攝軍機而遭警方逮捕。據韓媒報導，其中一人在調查中表示自己的父親是中國公安，部分媒體因此質疑這2人是否真是學生。
聲稱父親為公安的A某除這次外，去年下半年及今年初都曾入境韓國，每次滯留約4到5天；另一名B某則是在去年下半年，曾與A某同行入境韓國，同樣滯留4到5天。
對於拍攝軍機等照片的動機，2人表示是因為平時的興趣就是拍飛機，警方仍在對此進行調查。據稱，這2人光是拍攝軍機起降的照片就拍了100多張。
韓國在過去一年內數次發現中國人偷拍國內重要設施或竊取情報，包括去年6月3名
中國留學生在釜山港拍攝美軍航空母艦；同年11月1名中國人以無人機拍攝韓國國家情報院；今年1月有中國 觀光客被發現利用無人機拍攝濟州國際機場；上月29日則發現一名中國人偽裝成軍人企圖引誘韓國現役軍人洩漏軍事機密。
不過，由於韓國現行
間諜法適用範圍僅限於「敵國（北韓）」，上述案件皆不適用，僅涉嫌違反軍事基地及軍事設施保護法，與可能處死刑或無期徒刑及7年以上徒刑的間諜法不同，違反軍事基地及軍事設施保護法，最高處3年以下徒刑或3000萬韓元（約2萬美元）以下罰金。
這類事件頻發也引發韓國社會對相關法律及罰則的關注，但將間諜法擴大適用範圍的法案目前仍未能通過國會審議。
上一則

author: Asian News International
title: Shots Fired At Home Of Lakshmi Narayan Temple President's Son In Canada
text: The Lakshmi Narayan Mandir in Surrey received threats recently, cops said. (File) Shots were at the residence of an Indian-origin man in Canada's Surrey. Following this, the Royal Canadian Mounted Police has been investigating the incident. The firing happened on Wednesday (December 27) in the early morning at the residence of the son of Satish Kumar, the president of Lakshmi Narayan Mandir, in Surrey. According to the police, no one was injured during the incident. According to the Constable Parmbir Kahlon, Media Relations Officer for Surrey Police, the residence involved sustained damage consistent with bullet holes. "On December 27, 2023 at approximately 8:03 am, Surrey RCMP responded a to a report of shots fired at a residence in the 14900 block of 80 Avenue. No one was injured during the incident, but the residence involved sustained damage consistent with bullet holes. Police remained in the area, examining the scene, speaking with witnesses and canvassing the neighbourhood for CCTV footage. The Surrey RCMP General Investigation Unit has conduct of the investigation. Officers are still working to determine the motive of this incident. Anyone with more information, including dash cam footage of the incident, is asked to contact the Surrey RCMP," the Surrey Police said in its press release. Reportedly, the Surrey RCMP General Investigation Unit has conducted the investigation, and the officers are working to determine the motive of this incident, adding that the identities of the perpetrators are not known yet. The Surrey Police have not confirmed any link of the attack to recent threats received by the Lakshmi Narayan Mandir in Surrey. Earlier in November, India-origin Canadian member of Parliament Chandra Arya shared a purported video of Pro Khalistani supporters in Surrey claiming they want to create trouble at the Hindu Lakshmi Narayan Mandir there. He wrote, "Last week, Khalistan supporters verbally abused a Sikh family outside a Sikh Gurdwara in Surrey, BC, according to some reports. Now it appears the same Khalistan group wants to create trouble at the Hindu Lakshmi Narayan Mandir in Surrey." Underscoring that Hindu temples have remained targets for attacks over the past years, Arya noted by saying, "Hindu temples have been attacked many times during the last couple of years. Hate crimes are being committed against Hindu-Canadians." Moreover, a Hindu temple was vandalised in Canada by extremist elements with Khalistan referendum posters in August this year. In April this year, BAPS Swaminarayan temple was vandalised with anti-India graffiti in Windsor, in Canada's Ontario. Promoted Listen to the latest songs, only on JioSaavn.com Meanwhile, in February, the Ram Mandir in Canada's Mississauga was vandalised with anti-India graffiti. In January, a Hindu temple in Brampton was defaced with anti-India graffiti, triggering outrage among the Indian community. (Except for the headline, this story has not been edited by NDTV staff and is published from a syndicated feed.)
